channel.title: How would i add a JFrame to my client with buttons?
channel.description:
I have been learning java and i have made a good GUI but i don't know how to code the buttons yet. I have used NetBeans 6.5 and it helps me alot!!!
Here is what i made (i followed a tutorial).
[img]http://i40.tinypic.com/14czbmd.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i39.tinypic.com/2u7r29t.jpg[/img]
[size=20pt]so basically all i want to do is add a Menu button to my client like this...[/size]
[img]http://i44.tinypic.com/6hmjhf.jpg[/img]
So i can have more access to features whilst playing the game like music which is always cool.
I have tried opening up EGUI.java in NetBeans and Frame_Sub1.java but it doesn't let me go into the window editor to add labels and things.
Here is what the client looks like i am trying to add a JFrame to with buttons ect.
[img]http://i41.tinypic.com/ejsv8l.jpg[/img]
Well thanks so much i hope you can help!! :)

By Java Gods I mean the cunts at http://www.moparisthebest.com.
[/quote]

lolol u so funy lol did u mak dat up by urself?!!!1 rofl111!!!

Get back to the fields, nigger.[/quote]

real original!!

item.title: How would i add a JFrame to my client with buttons?
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

add the applet to a JPanel with borderlayout in position the center, then add another panel with the buttons in it to the first panel at position south

Read full topic

item.title: How would i add a JFrame to my client with buttons?
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Add a JPanel to the applet and add the buttons to your JPanel.

item.title: How would i add a JFrame to my client with buttons?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Read

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/ui/overview/index.html
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/ui/features/components.html
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/layout/visual.html

But keep in mind, the point of a tutorial is to teach you, don’t go straight to the examples, and then modify the example your needs, read the tutorial and start from scratch.

[quote=“io9, post:1, topic:271680”]You clearly have not “coded for a while,” and you definitely didn’t search for “decent tutorials,” because said tutorials are all at Sun’s Java tutorial site.
On top of that, you didn’t even write any of the first UI, you just used NetBeans’ WYSIWYG designer.

In closing, learn Java first, you fucking noob.[/quote]

It looks like he just copied the examples from the sun’s tutorials about it.

Read full topic
